Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.16762455]Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 6538 (MIC>60 µM), Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC=6 µM), Staphylococcus saprophytius (CS) (MIC=6 µM), Staphylococcus epidermius (CS) (MIC>60 µM), Bacillus subtilis CCT 2471 (MIC=60 µM), Bacillus thuringiensis (WT) (MIC>60 µM);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli CCT 1371 (MIC=6 µM), Escherichia coli ATCC 25922 (MIC=6 µM), Escherichia cloacae ATCC 23355 (MIC>60 µM), Proteus mirabilis (CS) (MIC>60 µM), Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 15442 (MIC=30 µM).
Sequence Information.Binding Target: Cell membrane (Note: Assumes an amphipathic alpha-helical conformation in a lipid environmen
Sequence Information.Function: Cationic linear alpha-helical antimicrobial peptide that binds preferentially to charged lipid membranes as compared with zwitterionic ones. It exhibits inhibitory activity against both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, and moderately stimulates degranulation from the rat peritoneal mast cells. Does not show hemolytic activity. May play a role in preventing infection by microorganisms during prey consumption by their larvae.

Literature.Title: Eumenitin, a novel antimicrobial peptide from the venom of the solitary eumenine wasp Eumenes rubronotatus.
Literature.Author: Konno K, Hisada M, Naoki H, Itagaki Y, Fontana R, Rangel M, Oliveira JS, Cabrera MP, Neto JR, Hide I, Nakata Y, Yasuhara T, Nakajima T.

Literature.Title: Effects of the cationic antimicrobial peptide eumenitin from the venom of solitary wasp Eumenes rubronotatus in planar lipid bilayers surface charge and pore formation activity.
Literature.Author: Arcisio-Miranda M, dos Santos Cabrera MP, Konno K, Rangel M, Procopio J.
